summary: Liam is skyping in this episode and just disappeared during an initiative roll because he went to go play with a cat. He is now...

Liam is skyping in this episode and just disappeared during an initiative roll because he went to go play with a cat. He is now holding the cat up to the camera.

Where does Caleb end and Liam begin?

blog.description: WOW/SWTOR. Captain Narava of both worlds. Goblin. My hobbies include: Crying while watching hockey, crying while watching Critical Role, and crying while watching Glee clips on YouTube. Also knitting. Over 40 and cool with it. Perniciously Aneimic, hella anxious, depressed widow, biromantic demisexual . Slytherin. OTP: Narava/Corso, Alt OTP: Avarane/Corso, Completely different fandom otp: Perc'ahlia. Pens/Stanley Cup. She/her. Unless you’re Taliesin Jaffe, I’m not interested.

blog.title: Looking For Awesome Orginial Content?
blog.description: Look somewhere else. Lover of fantasy in all mediums. I'm mostly a lurker who enjoys discussion.

summary: Longshot Theory
body:
Longshot Theory

So there’s been a lot of speculation on how the beacon and “consecutation” works, but what if part of it is holding souls in limbo until they can be reincarnated instead of letting them pass on. If that’s the case then the warrior the M9 fought in the sewers could come back and vouch for them a little (the M9 did let him go with the beacon after all) giving them just a little bit of credibility to counteract what happened this episode. Also I happened to like him and didn’t like the way he die so it’d be neat.

blog.description:
Waffles. Writer-Editor-Beta. 23. Female. Hong Kong-London.

Chinese. British by nationality.

Twin. Christian.

summary: ONE. OF. US.
body:
I found out that the other new trainee at work plays dnd today

I asked her how her weekend was and she said “uh. It’s kinda nerdy but I played dnd with my friends” *looked ready for judgment from me*

Me:

No joke I literally had to stare off in the middle distance, hold back tears and then try not to overwhelm her with 🤩

I ended up waving my arms like Liam here and babbling

She told me she plays a ranger dwarf that is three feet tall

I approved by nodding vigorously

She has a PDF of the player’s handbook that she’s going to send me

I WORK IN A LAW FIRM GUYS HOW DID THIS HAPPEN

ONE. OF. US.

blog.title: nott is a sexual woman
blog.description: AJ, they/them

summary: yeza, who doesn’t want to make his wife uncomfortable by calling her a name she doesn’t feel ready to use again, but also...
body:
yeza, who doesn’t want to make his wife uncomfortable by calling her a name she doesn’t feel ready to use again, but also doesn’t want to reinforce her poor self image decides to call her every pet name ever.

after “sweetheat” “honey” and “dearest” get old, he starts to move on to flowers- “daisy” “rose” “honeysuckle,” etc. this is far more successful, and he gets to see his wife smile and blush whenever he uses them, so win-win

he does not anticipate her returning the favor, and calling him every kind of pastry in the empire, and when she runs out, asks jester and fjord for coastal ones

he does not anticipate her returning the favor, and calling him every kind of pastry in the empire, and when she runs out, asks jester and fjord for coastal ones

tags: wizards and clerics being friends is even better
summary: Jester: “Caleb, how long until you can use that thingie?” Caleb: “Which thingie?” Jester: “The teleportation thingie.” Caleb:...
body:
Jester: “Caleb, how long until you can use that thingie?”
Caleb: “Which thingie?”
Jester: “The teleportation thingie.”
Caleb: “I…need to study. We are getting killed almost every day.”
Jester: “How long does it take to study?”
Caleb: “Years!”
Jester: “It’s going to be years before we can do that?!”
Caleb: “Well I don’t know, I need access to books and libraries and paper and ink, and not being -”
Jester: “Is that why you always look for books?!”
Nott: “Yes, he’s trying to find new powers and abilities.”
Jester: “But he already told you how to do it, didn’t he?”
Caleb: “…No.”
Jester (affronted): “He just said ‘Hey, here’s the thing’?”

I loved this exchange, because it’s such great RP of the difference between Wizard and Cleric spellcasting. Of course Jester’s baffled Caleb can’t just do a spell after Yussa “taught” him - she learns all her spells from the Traveler that way! He just shows her and then she knows! Why should Caleb have to spend time reading if someone already told him the spell? I love it.

What’s also great about this is it puts a whole new spin on Jester being one of the few characters besides Nott to consistently remember that Caleb wants books and to go looking for them with him. She cheerfully told him “and then we’ll find you some books!” on freakin’ Darktow, and happily showed him the bookstore in Nicodranas, all while apparently not fully realizing he wanted them for purely pragmatic reasons. 

Jester truly is the best.

Jester: “Is that why you always look for books?!”
Nott: “Yes, he’s trying to find new powers and abilities.”
Jester: “But he already told you how to do it, didn’t he?”
Caleb: “…No.”
Jester (affronted): “He just said ‘Hey, here’s the thing’?”

I loved this exchange, because it’s such great RP of the difference between Wizard and Cleric spellcasting. Of course Jester’s baffled Caleb can’t just do a spell after Yussa “taught” him - she learns all her spells from the Traveler that way! He just shows her and then she knows! Why should Caleb have to spend time reading if someone already told him the spell? I love it.

What’s also great about this is it puts a whole new spin on Jester being one of the few characters besides Nott to consistently remember that Caleb wants books and to go looking for them with him. She cheerfully told him “and then we’ll find you some books!” on freakin’ Darktow, and happily showed him the bookstore in Nicodranas, all while apparently not fully realizing he wanted them for purely pragmatic reasons. 

Jester truly is the best.

blog.name: bisexual-ben-solo
blog.title: Sad Wizards R Us
blog.description: listen to mitski and play a D&D. this is going to be my crit role side blog.

summary: I really hope Matt doesn’t ‘punish’ The Mighty Nein for giving back the dodecahedron (oh no ! Zaydash is destroyed and it’s all...
body:
I really hope Matt doesn’t ‘punish’ The Mighty Nein for giving back the dodecahedron (oh no ! Zaydash is destroyed and it’s all our fault !)

Here’s my thinking: never was The Mighty Nein going to be able to make the connections or powerful allys Vox Machina had in Taldori, in The Dwindalian Empire. The Dwindalian Empire from the start made it clear with how they discussed Allfields (they never mentioned the Mighty Nein, and instead claimed it was entirely the millitary.)

I keep thinking back to Matt’s notes of Zaydash, and the alternative routes the group could have taken. Two routes included majorly helping the empire (Taking down the Gentleman and returning the Dodecahedron to Zaydash). What particularly stood out to me was how almost blasé was the return Dodecahedron route….Their reward was simply some charms and a free pass to Pumat Sol.

And I know it’s not that simple, there are certain things about the Kryn that worry me too (altering the state of the world and leaving behind mass domes of eternal night feels wrong). I’m still of the mind set that a third contender will enter this war, potentially something that’s benefiting off of both nations fighting and not noticing their uprising. But seriously, The Mighty Nein was never going to find a home with the Empire.

Never was the Mighty Nein going to find sanctuary with an Empire that fundamentally doesn’t allow two of the PC characters Gods to exist. Never was the Mighty Nein going to find help from a place that doesn’t trust creatures that aren’t humans, elves, or halflings (if you look at some of Nott’s earliest views of the world and group you’ll understand).

Never was the group going to find a haven with the place that did experiments on one of their members as a child, indoctrinated and magically manipulated said child, took that child and tortured him, and then ordered him to kill his expendable parents (who were on the very bottom of the social ladder).

And that’s my beef.
